noun: an oral or written description of particular events or situations
an explanatory statement of conduct, as to a superior.
verb: to answer concerning one's conduct, duties, etc.

adjective: guilty of dishonest practices, as bribery; lacking integrity; crooked
debased in character; depraved; perverted; wicked; evil
verb: to destroy the integrity of; cause to be dishonest, disloyal, etc., especially by bribery.
to cause to indicate the same time, as one timepiece with another
to cause to go on, move, operate, work, etc., at the same rate and exactly together

noun: a sequence of two or more words arranged in a grammatical construction and acting as a unit in a sentence.
verb: to express or word in a particular way
to put (thought) into words; utter or state
adjective: clearly indicated; distinctly stated; definite; explicit; plain
noun: an express train, bus, elevator, etc

adjective: fully and clearly expressed or demonstrated; leaving nothing merely implied; unequivocal

verb: to bring out the capabilities or possibilities of; bring to a more advanced or effective state
to cause to grow or expand
to increase in extent, size, volume, scope, etc
to spread or stretch out; unfold
to increase or grow in extent, bulk, scope, etc

noun: the space or degree to which a thing extends; length, area, volume, or scope
something extended, as a space; a particular length, area, or volume; something having extension
any of a series of steps or stages, as in a process or course of action; a point in any scale
a stage or point in or as if in progression or retrogression
a single step or degree in a process; a particular phase, period, position, etc., in a process, development, or series.
a raised platform or floor, as for speakers, performers, etc
verb: to represent, produce, or exhibit on or as if on a stage
to furnish with a stage, staging, stage set, etc
